title: oc2ls version 1.0 json schema
description: This schema is intended to validate all possible derived content for the OpenC2 Language Specification version 1.0. It is meant to be used as a template that can be more strictly tuned when creating actuator profile specific schema

oneOf.description: A message defined by an Action-Target pair that is sent from a Producer and received by a Consumer
A message from a Consumer to a Producer acknowledging a Command or returning the requested resources or status to a previously received Command

OpenC2-Command.title: OpenC2 Command
OpenC2-Command.description: The Command defines an Action to be performed on a Target

action.description: The task or activity to be performed (i.e., the 'verb')

target.description: The object of the Action. The Action is performed on the Target

args.description: Additional information that applies to the Command

actuator.description: The subject of the Action. The Actuator executes the Action on the Target

status_text.description: A free-form human-readable description of the Response status

results.description: Map of key:value pairs that contain additional results based on the invoking Command

oneOf.description: Systematic examination of some aspect of the entity or its environment
Find an object physically, logically, functionally, or by organization
Initiate a request for information
Prevent a certain event or action from completion, such as preventing a flow from reaching a destination or preventing access
Isolate a file, process, or entity so that it cannot modify or access assets or processes
Permit access to or execution of a Target
Initiate a process, application, system, or activity
Halt a system or end an activity
Stop then start a system or an activity
Invalidate a previously issued Action
Change a value, configuration, or state of a managed entity
Instruct a component to retrieve, install, process, and operate in accordance with a software update, reconfiguration, or other update
Change the flow of traffic to a destination other than its original destination
Add a new entity of a known type (e.g., data, files, directories)
Remove an entity (e.g., data, files, flows)
Execute and observe the behavior of a Target (e.g., file, hyperlink) in an isolated environment
Return a system to a previously known state
Duplicate an object, file, data flow, or artifact
Task the recipient to aggregate and report information as it pertains to a security event or incident
Task the recipient to eliminate a vulnerability or attack point

properties.description: Data attribute associated with an Actuator

artifact.description: An array of bytes representing a file-like object or a link to that object

command.description: A reference to a previously issued Command

device.description: The properties of a hardware device

features.description: A set of items used with the query Action to determine an Actuator's capabilities

ipv4_net.description: An IPv4 address range including CIDR prefix length

ipv6_net.description: An IPv6 address range including prefix length

ipv4_connection.description: A 5-tuple of source and destination IPv4 address ranges, source and destination ports, and protocol

ipv6_connection.description: A 5-tuple of source and destination IPv6 address ranges, source and destination ports, and protocol

mac_addr.description: A Media Access Control (MAC) address - EUI-48 or EUI-64 as defined in [EUI]

process.description: Common properties of an instance of a computer program as executed on an operating system

^(slpf):[A-Za-z0-9]\\w+$.description: Language specification validator for committee approved extensions. In practice target extension should be a static property and this catch all should be removed

^x-[A-Za-z0-9]\\w+:[A-Za-z0-9]\\w+$.description: Language specification validator for custom target extensions. In practice target extension should be a static property and this catch all should be removed

^(slpf)$.description: Language specification validator for committee approved actuators. In practice actuators should be a static property and this catch all should be removed

^x-[A-Za-z0-9]\\w+$.description: Language specification validator for custom actuators. In practice actuators should be a static property and this catch all should be removed

start_time.description: The specific date/time to initiate the Command

stop_time.description: The specific date/time to terminate the Command

duration.description: The length of time for a Command to be in effect

response_requested.description: The type of Response required for the Command: none, ack, status, complete

^(slpf)$.description: Language specification validator for committee approved args extensions. In practice args extension should be a static property and this catch all should be removed

^x-[A-Za-z0-9]\\w+$.description: Language specification validator for custom args extensions. In practice args extension should be a static property and this catch all should be removed

oneOf.description: Processing - an interim Response used to inform the Producer that the Consumer has accepted the Command but has not yet completed it
OK - the Command has succeeded
Bad Request - the Consumer cannot process the Command due to something that is perceived to be a Producer error (e.g., malformed Command syntax)
Unauthorized - the Command Message lacks valid authentication credentials for the target resource or authorization has been refused for the submitted credentials
Forbidden - the Consumer understood the Command but refuses to authorize it
Not Found - the Consumer has not found anything matching the Command
Internal Error - the Consumer encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from performing the Command
Not Implemented - the Consumer does not support the functionality required to perform the Command
Service Unavailable - the Consumer is currently unable to perform the Command due to a temporary overloading or maintenance of the Consumer

versions.description: List of OpenC2 language versions supported by this Actuator

profiles.description: List of profiles supported by this Actuator

pairs.description: List of targets applicable to each supported Action

rate_limit.description: Maximum number of requests per minute supported by design or policy

^(slpf)$.description: Language specification validator for committee approved results extensions. In practice results extension should be a static property and this catch all should be removed

^x-[A-Za-z0-9]\\w+$.description: Language specification validator for custom results extensions. In practice results extension should be a static property and this catch all should be removed

mime_type.description: Permitted values specified in the IANA Media Types registry, [RFC6838]

payload.description: Choice of literal content or URL

hostname.description: A hostname that can be used to connect to this device over a network

idn_hostname.description: An internationalized hostname that can be used to connect to this device over a network

device_id.description: An identifier that refers to this device within an inventory or management system

Features.title: Features
Features.description: An array of zero to ten names used to query an Actuator for its supported capabilities

name.description: The name of the file as defined in the file system

path.description: The absolute path to the location of the file in the file system

hashes.description: One or more cryptographic hash codes of the file contents

IPv4-Net.title: IPv4 Net
IPv4-Net.description: IPv4 address as defined in [RFC0791] - CIDR prefix-length. If omitted, refers to a single host address

protocol.description: Layer 4 protocol (e.g., TCP) - see L4-Protocol section

IPv6-Net.title: IPv6 Net
IPv6-Net.description: IPv6 address as defined in [RFC8200] - CIDR prefix-length. If omitted, refers to a single host address

protocol.description: Layer 4 protocol (e.g., TCP) - see L4-Protocol section

MAC-Addr.title: MAC Address
MAC-Addr.description: Media Access Control / Extended Unique Identifier address - EUI-48 or EUI-64 as defined in [EUI]

cwd.description: Current working directory of the process

executable.description: Executable that was executed to start the process

command_line.description: The full command line invocation used to start this process, including all arguments

Properties.title: Properties
Properties.description: A list of names that uniquely identify properties of an Actuator

items.description: In practice this should be a "oneOf" list of "const" and "description" that contains static values for the specific actuator profile

Action-Targets.title: Action Targets
Action-Targets.description: Map of each action supported by this actuator to the list of targets applicable to that action

Feature.title: Feature
Feature.description: Specifies the results to be returned from a query features Command

oneOf.description: List of OpenC2 Language versions supported by this Actuator
List of profiles supported by this Actuator
List of supported Actions and applicable Targets
Maximum number of Commands per minute supported by design or policy

Hostname.title: Hostname
Hostname.description: Internet host name as specified in [RFC1123]

IDN-Hostname.title: Internationalized Hostname
IDN-Hostname.description: Internationalized Internet host name as specified in [RFC5890], Section 2.3.2.3

L4-Protocol.title: Layer 4 Protocol
L4-Protocol.description: Value of the protocol (IPv4) or next header (IPv6) field in an IP packet. Any IANA value, [RFC5237]

oneOf.description: Internet Control Message Protocol - [RFC0792]
Transmission Control Protocol - [RFC0793]
User Datagram Protocol - [RFC0768]
Stream Control Transmission Protocol - [RFC4960]

Nsid.title: Namespace Identifier
Nsid.description: A short identifier that refers to a namespace

bin.description: Specifies the data contained in the artifact

url.description: MUST be a valid URL that resolves to the un-encoded content

oneOf.description: No response
Respond when Command received
Respond with progress toward Command completion
Respond when all aspects of Command completed

Versions.title: Versions
Versions.description: List of OpenC2 language versions supported by this Actuator

Profiles.title: Profiles
Profiles.description: List of profiles supported by this Actuator

Rate-Limit.title: Rate Limit
Rate-Limit.description: Maximum number of requests per minute supported by design or policy
